channel.title: Ubuntu Nvidia Drivers
channel.description: Hi, I've been using Linux for a while, and I just got a new machine I'm going to use as a MySQL server and for some Linux games. I have an nVidia GeForce 6100, and I've downloaded the drivers, downloaded the kernel source (It asked for it) and installed, ok, works great. I reboot, and I get the Ubuntu loading screen, dum de dum de dum, ok done loading. "Failed to start X, restart GDM" and something about looking at log files. I type startx or something, and it runs, ok, then I get the login screen. This is a problem with my driver and x server not liking each other right? Any help, I can boot up my machine and give you some more details if you need.

item.title: Ubuntu Nvidia Drivers
item.dc:creator: @Quilby Quilby
item.description:
@Quilby wrote:

7.06 Did not come out yet and it never will… Current stable is 7.04.
And yes you got it working because of a new feature for restricted drivers…
In gnome go to system > admin > restricted drivers manager.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Nvidia Drivers
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Well, I got 7.06 working great, with Beryl. Its TEH SHIT!

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Nvidia Drivers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:9, topic:82908”][quote author=kloplop321 link=topic=121817.msg1203585#msg1203585 date=1177315402]
6.06 isn’t recomended, but Kubuntu 6.10 works great for me. I’ll try this!
[/quote]wtf do you mean it isnt recommended? 6.06 is the version of ubuntu with long term support[/quote]

Yea, it is supported for a few more years I believe.

But that link frank_ posted before to the program called Envy works great, I tried it a few days ago on my laptop and it got the ATI drivers working perfectly.

Read full topic
